Fava beans or broad beans can be hard to find in America.  I recommend looking for the pod version in farmers' markets and the frozen, shelled version in the freezer section at good, broad-thinking health-oriented markets or Middle Easter markets.  If you can't find them, try substituting with baby green lima beans or even sweet peas.  To prepare the whole fava beans, start with grams of fava bean pods.  Snap off the tops, and slide the beans out.  With both the frozen and the fresh, blanch in salted boiling water for minutes, then shock in an ice bath.  Squeeze the green bean from inside the pale green bean skin (you won't need to do this with the little frozen ones).  All ready to go.
